issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has not yet been validated, and is not currently being investigated.
status.name: Unconfirmed

fields.description:
I created and deleted a volume and now I keep getting these error messages repeated over and over.  I know the volume has been deleted because it no longer exists when running euca-describe-volumes.  I'm not sure what else happened that would cause this error.
{code}
Tue Jan 6 14:47:27 2015 ERROR [DASManager:Eucalyptus.storage.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#516] [com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.DASManager.deleteVolume(DASManager.java):532] Cannot delete volume vol-07b41248 because it is currently exported

comments.body: [~ccassler], are you able to reproduce this issue? If yes, can you email me details of the cloud setup?

[~ccassler]: I found one volume, vol-07b41248, that the SC has been attempting to delete since 01/04 at least. The logs have rolled and I can't see the history beyond that. Volume deletion seems to be failing as the volume is currently exported. Has there been any issue with this volume before? 

[~zhill] This looks like a case where the SC does not have any export records for the volume but the volume is actually exported. I thought we force clear all the exports before deleting the volume. But that might be based off the export records and not the actual status. I also remember some concurrency issues in this part of the DASManager when threads race to unexport the volume and delete it. I see some synchronized blocks in the code now. I think it would be safe to unexport the volume if its exported before deletion in the DASManager. I'm going to be out tomorrow and over the weekend but I can take a look at this after I get back.
